name: Ahmed Ali
text: ALL PRAISE BE to God who has revealed to His votary the Book which is free of all obliquity,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Immutable, so that it may warn of a severe punishment from Him; and give happy tidings to those who believe and do the right that there is a better reward (of Paradise) for them,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Where they will abide for ever;

name: Ahmed Ali
text: And that it may warn those who say: "God has begotten a son."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: They have no knowledge of this, as their fathers did not have. How terrible are the words they utter! They speak nothing but lies.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Will you kill yourself for grief of them if they do not believe in this presentation?

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We have made whatever exists on the earth its adornment to test and try them (and) know who acts better;

name: Ahmed Ali
text: For We shall certainly turn it to barren dust.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Do you think the men of the cave and Ar-Raqim were so strange among Our signs?

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When those young men took shelter in the cave, and prayed: "O Lord, grant us Your favour and dispose our affair aright,"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We sealed off their ears in the cave for a number of years,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Then roused them to ascertain which of the two groups could account for the period they had stayed.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We narrate their story to you in all truth. They were a few young men who believed in their Lord; so We gave them greater guidance.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: And strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We shall invoke no god beside Him, for we shall have uttered a blasphemy then.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: As for these our people here, they have taken to other gods apart from Him. Then why do they not bring a clear authority for them? Who is more wicked than he who fabricates a lie against God?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: (And they said to each other:) "Now that you have withdrawn from them and what they worship beside God, it is better to take refuge in the cave. Your Lord may bestow of His mercy on you, and facilitate your affair."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: You may well have seen when the sun came up it moved away to the right of the cave, and when it went down it turned away to the left, and they stayed in its open space. This was among the signs of God. Whoever is guided by God follows the right path; and whosoever goes astray will not find a guide to show him the way.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: You may have thought that they were awake, yet they were asleep. We made them turn right and left, while their dog lay with his forelegs stretched across the threshold. If you had looked at them you would have surely turned away and fled with horror at the sight.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Even so We roused them that they may question one another. One of them asked: "How long have you stayed here?" They said: "A day or less than a day." "Your Lord knows best," they said, "how long you have stayed. So send one of you to the town with this money of yours to look for wholesome food and bring it for you; but he should be careful not to let your presence known.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: If they come to know of you they will stone you to death, or force you to go back to their creed; then you will never succeed."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Thus did We inform the people about them that they may know the promise of God is true, and there is no doubt that the Hour will come. As they were arguing among themselves as to what should be done with them, (some) said: "Erect a monument over them. Their Lord is best cognisant of them." Those who prevailed, said: "We shall build a place of worship over their (sepulchre)."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Some will say: "They were three, and their dog was the fourth;" and some will also say: "They were five and their dog was the sixth," -- guessing in the dark. And some will even say: "They were seven, and their dog the eighth." Say: "My Lord alone knows best their number; none but only a few know of them." So do not argue about it with them but lightly, and do not enquire about them from any one of them.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Do not say of any thing: "I will do it tomorrow,"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Without (adding), "if God may please;" and think of your Lord in ease you forget, and say: "Perhaps my Lord will show me a nearer way to rectitude."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: (It is said) they stayed in the cave three hundred years and nine.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: You say: "God only knows how long they stayed. He alone knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. How distinctly He sees and hears! They have no other guardian but Him, and He does not share His authority with any one."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no one who can change the word of God; and you will not find refuge except in Him.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Persevere with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His magnificence. Do not turn your eyes away from them, seeking the splendours of this world, and do not follow him whose heart We have made oblivious to Our remembrance, who follows his own lust and exceeds the bound.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Say: "The truth is from your Lord: So believe if you like, or do not believe if you will." We have prepared for the sinners a fire which will envelope them in its tent. If they ask for water they will be helped to liquid like molten brass that would scald their mouths. How evil the drink, and evil the resting-place!

name: Ahmed Ali
text: But surely We do not let the reward of those who believe and do the right to go waste.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: There will be gardens of Eden for them, with rivers flowing by, where they will be decked in bracelets of gold, with silken robes of green and of brocades to wear, reclining on couches. How excellent the guerdon, and excellent the resting-place!

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Tell them the parable of two men. We gave one two gardens of grapes surrounded by date-palm trees, with corn fields in between.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Each of the gardens yielded its fruit and did not withhold the least; and We made a stream flow in between them.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: So he became rich. Arguing one day with his friend he said: "I have more wealth than you and more powerful kinsmen."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: And he walked into his garden, and, (forgetting) his limit, said: "I cannot imagine that this will ever be ruined,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Nor can I think that the Hour (of Doom) will come, And even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better place there than this."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Disputing with him, his companion said: "Do you disbelieve in Him who created you from dust, then a drop of semen, then formed you into a man?

name: Ahmed Ali
text: And He is God, my Lord, and I do not associate any one with my Lord.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When you entered your garden, why did you not say: 'As God may please;' for no one has power except given by God? Though you see me poorer in wealth and children than you,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Yet, my Lord may haply give me a garden better than yours, and He may send a thunder-bolt, from the skies and in the morning it will be a barren plain;

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Or else of a morning its water may sink underground, and you will not find a trace of it."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: And his vines were overtaken (with disaster), and he began to wring his hands (at the loss) of what he had spent on them, for the vines had fallen upon their trellises; and he said: "Would to God that I had not associated any one with my Lord."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He had no body to help him other than God, nor was he able to save himself.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The jurisdiction in this province belongs to God. His is the best reward, and His the best requital.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Present to them the example of the life of this world so like the water We send down from the skies that mingles with the earth to nourish its vegetation, which then on the morrow turns to stubble and is blown away by the wind. God has power over everything.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Wealth and children are only the gloss of this world, but good deeds that abide are better with your Lord for recompense, and better for expectation.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The day We shall move the mountains, and you see the earth an open plain, We shall gather them together, leaving none behind.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: They will be arraigned before their Lord row on row, (and He will say): "Well, you have come to Us as We had first created you, even though you imagined We had fixed no time for this meeting."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The ledger (of their deeds) would be placed before them. Then you will see the sinners terrified at its contents, and say: "Alas, what a written revelation this, which has not left unaccounted the smallest or the greatest thing!" They will find in it whatsoever they had done. Your Lord does not wrong any one.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When We said to the angels: "Bow before Adam in adoration," they all bowed but Iblis. He was one of the jinni and rebelled against his Lord's command. And yet you take him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, even though they are your enemies. How sad a substitute for the evil-doers!

name: Ahmed Ali
text: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation. I would not take as helpers those who lead (men) astray.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The day He will say: "Call those you had called My compeers," they will call them, but will get no response, and We shall place a gulf between them.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The sinners will see the Fire and know that they will be thrown into it and will not find a way of escape from it.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We have explained in various ways all things to men in this Qur'an; but of all things man is most contentious.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: There is nothing to prevent men from believing when the guidance has come to them, and asking for their Lord's forgiveness, unless they want the example of earlier people visited upon them, or the punishment to appear right before their eyes.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We never send apostles but to convey happy tidings, and to warn. But those who disbelieve contend with false arguments to nullify the truth. They make a mockery of My revelations and of what they had been warned.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Who is more unjust than he who, on being reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets the evil deeds he had committed in the past. Verily We have placed a covering on their hearts so that they do not understand, and a deafness in their ears so that however you may call them to guidance they will never be guided aright.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: But your Lord is forgiving, full of benevolence. If He had pleased to punish them for their doings He would have punished them immediately. But a term is fixed for them from which they will find no escape.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: As for these habitations, We destroyed them only when they transgressed; even so We had fixed a time for their annihilation.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When Moses said to his servant (Joshua): "I will not give up till I reach the confluence of two oceans, or I will journey on and on."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He said: "You see, I forgot the fish on the rock where we had stopped. Only Satan made me forget to mention this; but the wonder is the fish escaped to the sea."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Then they found one of Our votaries, whom We had blessed and given knowledge from Us.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He said: "You will not be able to bear with me.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "How can you bear that which is beyond your comprehension?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "You will find me patient if God wills," said Moses; "and I will not disobey you in any thing."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "If you must follow me," he said, "do not ask me any thing until I speak of it to you myself."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: So they set out till they (came to the quay) and went on board a ship in which he made a hole, (and Moses said:) "You have made a hole in the boat to drown its passengers? You have done a strange thing!"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "Did I not tell you," he replied, "that you will not be able to bear with me?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The two went on till they came to a boy, whom he killed. Moses exclaimed: "You have killed an innocent soul who had taken no life. You have done a most abominable thing!"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He said: "Did I not tell you you will not be able to bear with me?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Moses said: "If I ask you any thing again then do not keep me with you. You have my apology."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: The two went on till they came upon some villagers, and asked the people for food, but they refused to entertain them. There they found a wall that was crumbling, which he repaired. Moses remarked: "You could have demanded wages for it if you liked."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "This is the parting of our "ways," he said. "But I will now explain the things you could not bear:

name: Ahmed Ali
text: That boat belonged to poor people who used to toil on the sea. I damaged it because there was a king after them who used to seize every ship by force.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: As for the boy, his parents were believers, but we feared that he would harass them with defiance and disbelief.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We hoped their Lord would give them a substitute better than him in virtue and goodness.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: As for that wall, it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and their treasure was buried under it. Their father was an upright man. So your Lord willed that on reaching the age of maturity they should dig out their treasure as a favour from their Lord. So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: They ask you about Dhu'l-Qarnain.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Say: "I will cite before you his commemoration." We gave him authority in the land and means of accomplishing every end.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: So he followed a certain road

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Till he reached the point of the setting sun, and saw it set behind a muddy lake, and near it found a people. We said: "O Dhu'l-Qarnain, you may either punish them or treat them with kindness."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He said: "I shall punish whosoever is wicked. He will then be sent back to his Lord who will inflict on him a terrible punishment.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: But he who believes and does the right will have an excellent reward, and we shall make things easy for him."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He then followed (another) road

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Till he reached the point of the rising sun, and saw it rise over a people for whom We had provided no shelter against it.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: It was so, for We were fully informed about him.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He then followed (another) road

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Till he reached a place between two mountains, and found this side of it a people who understood but little of what was spoken.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: They said: 'O Dhu'l-Qarnain, Gog and Magog are oppressing the land. May we pay you some tribute so that you could build a rampart between us and them?"

name: Ahmed Ali
text: He said: "The ability my Lord has given me is better. So help me with your manual labour; I will build a wall between you and them.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up. "Blow your bellows," he said; (and they blew) until it was red hot. "Bring me molten brass," he said, "that I may pour over it."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Thus (Gog and Magog) could neither climb over it nor dig a hole through (the rampart).

name: Ahmed Ali
text: "This is the benevolence of my Lord," he said; "but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will reduce it to a mound of dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: We shall leave them on that day surging like waves pressing one against the other, and the trumpet blast will be sounded, when We shall gather them all together.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Then We shall bring Hell right before the infidels

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Whose eyes were veiled against My warning, and they could not hear.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Do the unbelievers think they can make My own creatures their protectors against Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of infidels.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Say: "Shall I tell you whose labour will be wasted?

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Theirs whose effort is misspent in pursuit of the pleasures of the world, even though they think they are doing good things."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: They are those who reject the signs of their Lord, and the meeting with Him. So their good deeds will be fruitless, and on the Day of Judgement We shall not appoint any weighing for them.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Their requital will be Hell, because they disbelieved and mocked My signs and messengers.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: But surely those who believe and do the right will have gardens of Paradise as gift,

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Where they will abide for ever, never wanting a change.

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Say: "If the ocean turned to ink for writing down the colloquy of my Lord, the ocean itself would be exhausted ere the words (and wonders) of my Lord come to end, even if we brought another like it for replenishment."

name: Ahmed Ali
text: Say: "I am only a man like you, but it has been communicated to me that your Lord is one and single God, and that whosoever hopes to meet his Lord should do what is right, and not associate any one in the worship of his Lord."
